content:
Yes, there are other high-fat foods that are considered healthy, like avocados. Some examples include:

1. Nuts and seeds - these include almonds, cashews, chia seeds, flaxseeds, and pumpkin seeds. They are packed with healthy fats, protein, and fiber, making them a great snack option.

2. Salmon - this fatty fish is a great source of omega-3 fatty acids, which offer many health benefits, including lowering inflammation and reducing the risk of heart disease.

3. Olive oil - this healthy fat is a staple in the Mediterranean diet and has been linked to reducing the risk of heart disease, stroke, and certain types of cancer.

4. Full-fat yogurt - plain, full-fat yogurt is a great source of healthy fats, protein, and probiotics, which aid in digestion and support a healthy gut.

5. Dark chocolate - in moderation, dark chocolate can be a great source of healthy fats, antioxidants and can also have a variety of health benefits like improving heart health, brain function, and mood.

Like avocado, it's important to consume these high-fat foods in moderation as part of a balanced diet to reap their health benefits.
